--- title: pyshell keywords: fastai sidebar: home_sidebar summary: "A Shell class to exectue shell commands as object methods." description: "A Shell class to exectue shell commands as object methods." nb_path: "index.ipynb" ---
{% raw %}
{% endraw %}

Install 

git clone git@github.com:ababino/pyshell.git
cd pyshell
pip install .

How to use

Import

{% raw %} 
from pyshell.core import *
{% endraw %}

Create a shell object

{% raw %} 
sh = Shell()
{% endraw %}

Call shell commands as object methods

{% raw %} 
print(sh.ls())

autocomplete.png

{% endraw %}

Use the flags kwarg for single dash arguments

{% raw %} 
print(sh.ls('.giti*', flags='a'))

.gitignore
{% endraw %}

Use kwargs for double dash arguments

{% raw %} 
print(sh.du('.', max_depth=0))

324	.
{% endraw %}

You can use tab to autocomplete:

If there is a man page, it becomes the method's docstring

Limitations

Each command is executed as a different process.
